To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.
Day unto day uttereth speech, and night unto night sheweth knowledge.
<FI>There is<Fi> no speech nor language, <FI>where<Fi> their voice is not heard.<RF>whereâ€¦: or, without these their voice is heard: Heb. without their voice heard<Rf>
Their line is gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun,<RF>line: or, rule, or, direction<Rf>
Which <FI>is<Fi> as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, <FI>and<Fi> rejoiceth as a strong man to run a race.
His going forth <FI>is<Fi> from the end of the heaven, and his circuit unto the ends of it: and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.<CM>
The law of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> perfect, converting the soul: the testimony of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> sure, making wise the simple.<RF>law: or, doctrine<Rf><RF>converting: or, restoring<Rf>
The statutes of the LORD <FI>are<Fi> right, rejoicing the heart: the commandment of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> pure, enlightening the eyes.
The fear of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> clean, enduring for ever: the judgments of the LORD <FI>are<Fi> true <FI>and<Fi> righteous altogether.<RF>true: Heb. truth<Rf>
More to be desired <FI>are they<Fi> than gold, yea, than much fine gold: sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.<RF>the honeycomb: Heb. the dropping of honeycombs<Rf>
Moreover by them is thy servant warned: <FI>and<Fi> in keeping of them <FI>there is<Fi> great reward.
Who can understand <FI>his<Fi> errors? cleanse thou me from secret <FI>faults<Fi>.

Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous <FI>sins<Fi>; let them not have dominion over me: then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent from the great transgression.<RF>the great: or, much<Rf>
Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O LORD, my strength, and my redeemer.<RF>strength: Heb. rock<Rf><CM>
